title: San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park: Spoken Word
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations     Spoken Word                Spoken Word                         Excerpt from E.A. Poe's Story of a Sea Voyage Gone Wrong  A reading by Lynn Cullivan from E.A. Poe's short story "A Descent Into the Maelstrom" (1841), where a man tells a story of fantastical events at sea. Published in many versions including Great stories of the sea and ships (1992), http://keys.bywatersolutions.com/cgi-bin/koha/opac-detail.pl?biblionumber=27236, a complete publication history of the story is available here: http://www.eapoe.org/works/info/pt032.htm  Duration:49 seconds                                Ode to the Gain by Matthew Nienow Leslie Graham reads the poem Ode to the Gain by Matthew Nienow. A gain, as stated by the Poetry Foundation, is "a bevel cut into plank ends in traditional lapstrake boat construction that allows otherwise lapped planks to lay flush at stem and transom."  Copyright by, and posted with the permission of, Matthew Nienow, http://www.poetryfoundation.org/bio/matthew-nienow#poet  Duration:51 seconds                                A Reading from L'Horizon Chimérique  A selection from L'Horizon Chimérique by French poet Jean de La Ville de Mirmont as read by Ava Roy, Artistic Director of the theatrical group We Players.  Duration:3 minutes, 17 seconds                                Rime of the Ancient Mariner, Part II Ava Roy, Artistic Director of the We Players, reads Part II of The Rime of the Ancient Mariner (1834) by Samuel Taylor Coleridge. Find this book in the SF Maritime NHP Research Center: http://keys.bywatersolutions.com/cgi-bin/koha/opac-search.pl?q=coleridge+rime+ancient+mariner  Duration:3 minutes, 19 seconds
